intro: Phyllodes imbricata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf wattle, is a species of acacia native to Australia. It is characterized by its slender, linear phyllodes that are typically 5–15 cm in length. The plant produces yellow flowers in dense spikes, which bloom from late summer to autumn. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Phyllodes imbricata is a hardy shrub that plays an important role in its native ecosystem.
